required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: THERMOCOOL® SMARTTOUCH™ Catheter for the Treatment of Symptomatic Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation CONTINUED ACCESS
clinical_study.official_title: THERMOCOOL® SMARTTOUCH™ Catheter for the Treatment of Symptomatic Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation Continued Access

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multicenter, non-randomized continued access clinical evaluation utilizing the THERMOCOOL® SMARTTOUCH™ catheter.

detailed_description.textblock: The device is currently under investigation with IDE #G110030. This continued access study will enroll subjects that have participated in the Smart-AF IDE study. Subjects with drug refractory symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (PAF) will be considered for this study. Effectiveness and safety endpoints have been defined and will be evaluated post treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study had a single arm: catheter ablation for PAF

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieved Freedom From Atrial Tachyarrhythmias
primary_outcome.description: Freedom from documented symptomatic atrial fibrillation/atrial tachycardia/atrial flutter (hereinafter collectively referred to as "atrial tachyarrhythmias") based on electrocardiographic data during the effectiveness evaluation period (Day 91-361). Acute procedure failures, antiarrhythmic drug(AAD) changes and repeat ablation occurring during evaluation period were deemed as primary effectiveness failures

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Primary Adverse Events Within Specified Study Period
primary_outcome.description: Primary safety endpoint consists of primary adverse events (AE) within 7 days post procedure Or pulmonary vein stenosis and atrio-esophageal fistula events that occurred within 12 months post-procedure. Primary adverse events include death, myocardial infarction, pulmonary vein stenosis, diaphragmatic paralysis, atrio-esophageal fistula, transient ischemic attack, stroke / cerebrovascular accident, thromboembolism, pericarditis, cardiac tamponade, pericardial effusion, pneumothorax, atrial perforation, vascular access complications, pulmonary edema, initial and prolonged hospitalization (excluding those due to pre-existing arrhythmia recurrence), heart block.

secondary_outcome.description: Peri-procedural serious adverse events (SAEs) are those non-primary SAEs occurred within 8-30 days post procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieved Acute Effectiveness
secondary_outcome.description: Acute effectivenesss is defined as confirmation of entrance block into all Pulmonary veins

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 31 days post procedure to month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Late onset serious adverse events (SAEs) are those non-primary SAEs occurred after 31 days post procedure

clinical_study.condition: Drug Refractory Symptomatic Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have had at least 3 atrial fibrillation episodes within 6 months of this study
- Have failed at least one antiarrhythmic drug shown by repeated atrial fibrillation episodes
- 18 years of age or older
Exclusion Criteria including, but not limited to:
- Have had previous ablation for atrial fibrillation
- Have take amiodarone within 6 months of this study
- Have had any heart surgery within the last 60 days
- Have had a heart attack within the last 60 days
- Females who are pregnant or breast feeding

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study enrolled 148 subjects at 15 clinical sites in the U.S. over the course of approximately 8 months. The first subject was enrolled on July 26, 2012, and the last subject was enrolled on March 18, 2013. The study’s last index ablation procedure was on April 24, 2013.

Primary adverse events include death, myocardial infarction, pulmonary vein stenosis, diaphragmatic paralysis, atrio-esophageal fistula, transient ischemic attack, stroke / cerebrovascular accident, thromboembolism, pericarditis, cardiac tamponade, pericardial effusion, pneumothorax, atrial perforation, vascular access complications, pulmonary edema, initial and prolonged hospitalization (excluding those due to pre-existing arrhythmia recurrence), heart block.

measure.title: Incidence of Primary Adverse Events Within Specified Study Period
measure.description: Primary safety endpoint consists of primary adverse events (AE) within 7 days post procedure Or pulmonary vein stenosis and atrio-esophageal fistula events that occurred within 12 months post-procedure. Primary adverse events include death, myocardial infarction, pulmonary vein stenosis, diaphragmatic paralysis, atrio-esophageal fistula, transient ischemic attack, stroke / cerebrovascular accident, thromboembolism, pericarditis, cardiac tamponade, pericardial effusion, pneumothorax, atrial perforation, vascular access complications, pulmonary edema, initial and prolonged hospitalization (excluding those due to pre-existing arrhythmia recurrence), heart block.

measure.units: percentage of subjects with primary AE

analysis.param_type: Percentage of subjects with primary AEs
analysis.estimate_desc: The 2-sided 95% confidence interval is exact binomial

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieved Acute Effectiveness
outcome.description: Acute effectivenesss is defined as confirmation of entrance block into all Pulmonary veins
outcome.population: Effectiveness cohort, defined as those enrolled subjects who underwent insertion of the study catheter and an AF ablation procedure. Subjects without RF energy delivery will be excluded (i.e. discontinued subjects).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between the Principal Investigator (PI)/Institution and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss, present or publish trial results after the trial is completed. Please contact Biosense Webster, Inc. for additional information.
